properties.short description: Rainulf II and Robert II Occupied the Caudine Valley
properties.description: Preparing for Roger II's retribution, Rainulf II and Robert II prepare a force of cavalry and occupy the Caudine Valley.
properties.people:
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alise
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: To prevent Bari from rebelling again, Roger II had its towers destroyed.  The citadel he had begun constructing was finished.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II strengthened the city of Troia while dividing its people.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II abandoned the siege of Naples and focused on repairing the defenses of Cuculo, which had suffered attacks from Pisan mercenaries.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
